Class Eschaton::JavascriptObject
In: lib/eschaton/javascript/javascript_object.rb
Parent: Object

Represents a javascript object on which you can call methods and assign fields.

Any method called on this object will translate the methods into a javascript compatable camelCase method which is called on the var. Calls are stacked and javascript is returned by calling to_s.

Methods

<<   existing   method_missing   method_to_js   new   script   to_js   to_json   to_s  

External Aliases

create_var -> create_var?

Attributes

create_var  [R] 
var  [R] 

Public Class methods

existing(options)

Used to work on an existing javascript variable by setting the create_var option to false. It is recommended that an existing JavascriptGenerator be supplied as the script option.

Supports the same options as new.

[Source]

    # File lib/eschaton/javascript/javascript_object.rb, line 26
26:     def self.existing(options)
27:       options[:create_var] = false
28: 
29:       self.new(options)
30:     end
new(options = {})

Options:

  • var - Optional. The name of the javascript variable, defaulted to a random name.
  • create_var - Optional. Indicates whether the javascript variable should be created and assigned, defaulted to true.
  • script - Optional. The script object to use for generation.

[Source]

    # File lib/eschaton/javascript/javascript_object.rb, line 14
14:     def initialize(options = {})
15:       options.default! :var => :random, :create_var => true
16:     
17:       self.var = options.extract(:var)
18:       @create_var = options.extract(:create_var)
19:       @script = options.extract(:script)
20:     end

Public Instance methods

<<(javascript)

Adds javascript to the generator.

self << "var i = 10;"

[Source]

    # File lib/eschaton/javascript/javascript_object.rb, line 44

method_missing(method, *args)

Alias for method_to_js

method_to_js(method, *args)

Converts the given method and args to a javascript method call with arguments.

[Source]

    # File lib/eschaton/javascript/javascript_object.rb, line 35
35:     def method_to_js(method, *args)
36:       self << "#{self.var}.#{method.to_js_method}(#{args.to_js_arguments});"
37:     end
to_js()

Protected Instance methods

script()

Returns either the Eschaton#global_script(if one is set) or this objects script generator.

[Source]

    # File lib/eschaton/javascript/javascript_object.rb, line 60
60:       def script
61:         @script || Eschaton.global_script
62:       end
